sentences.en: A censor blipped the swear words.
sentences.cn: 审查员把粗鄙的话用哗哗声消掉.

sentences.en: Don't write anything that will bother the censor.
sentences.cn: 你可别写什么给检查员找麻烦的话.

sentences.en: He sent the draft to the censor's office by a runner.
sentences.cn: 他让信使把稿件送到新闻检查官办公室.

sentences.en: It is not constitutional to censor the press.
sentences.cn: 审查新闻是违反宪法的.

sentences.en: ITV companies tend to censor bad language in feature films.
sentences.cn: 独立电视公司一般都会删掉故事片里的脏话。

sentences.en: Linda Gradstein has this report from Jerusalem, which was cleared by an Israeli censor.
sentences.cn: 琳达·格拉德斯坦的这份报道来自耶路撒冷，它已经通过了以色列方面的审查。

sentences.en: Television companies tend to censor bad language in feature films.
sentences.cn: 电视公司往往会在审查故事片时删去其中的粗话。

sentences.en: The censor clipped the swearing words.
sentences.cn: 电影审查员剪去了骂人的话.

sentences.en: The censor demanded that the scene be written out.
sentences.cn: 审查员要求把这个情节抹掉.

sentences.en: The censor insisted on excising the passage from the film.
sentences.cn: 电影审查员坚持剪去影片的这一段.

sentences.en: The censor struck out the next two lines.
sentences.cn: 审查员划掉了下面两行。

sentences.en: The film came under the ban of censor.
sentences.cn: 该影片被审查官员禁止上映.

sentences.en: The film has not been viewed by the censor.
sentences.cn: 这部影片还未经审查人员审查.

sentences.en: The film hasn't been viewed by the censor.
The information given to the press was carefully censored by the Ministry of Defence.
sentences.cn: 发布给报界的信息经过了国防部的仔细审查。

sentences.en: The report was cleared by the American military censors.
sentences.cn: 这篇报道被美国军方审查员删掉了。

sentences.en: Tim wrote a piece about the night life here. The censor killed it dead.
sentences.cn: 蒂姆写过一篇关于这里夜生活的文章, 给新闻检查官枪毙了.

words.tran_cn: 监察的，审查的；检查官的

trans.tran_en: someone whose job is to examine books, films, letters etc and remove anything considered to be offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous
someone whose job is to examine books, films, letters etc and remove anything considered to be offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous
to examine books, films, letters etc to remove anything that is considered offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous etc
to examine books, films, letters etc to remove anything that is considered offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous etc
